episodes.title: How Scientology Used Music and Dancers to Hide Their Identity
episodes.description:
L. Ron Hubbard and Scientology had a BIG problem in the early 1970s when they operated in the Mediterranean and Caribbean on their Flagship Apollo.  They needed to hide their identity due to fear of government officials and law enforcement.  The Apollo Stars and dancers were created to hide that identity with local port officials through free concerts and events.   Neil Sarfati is back with more stories about the Apollo Stars and how it became an avenue for Sea Org Members to get out of the Sea Org prison program - the Rehabilitation Project Force.

episodes.title: Pamela Nickel Williams New Book - Clearly Lies are True - A Memoir
episodes.description:
Pamela Nickel Williams was born into world of Scientology. Her parents, captivated by L. Ron Hubbard in the 1950s, followed his path from Wichita, Kansas, to Washington DC, then to the iconic Saint Hill Manor in England, and finally aboard the Royal Scotman, the first Sea Organization Ship. As a child, Pamela faced challenges that ultimately distanced her from Scientology and her parents during her teenage years. Years later, a pivotal experience drove her to explore her childhood, leading her to uncover the reasons behind her parents' commitment to Hubbard and Scientology. The outcome? Her powerful memoir, "Clearly Lies are True." Join her as she sits down with Mark Fisher to discuss the book and her personal revelations about herself and her parents.

episodes.title: Our First Year in Las Vegas After Leaving Scientology
episodes.description:
When Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady finally broke free from Scientology after years of unwavering commitment, they dreamed of a fresh start in Las Vegas, Nevada. However, Scientology Cult Leader David Miscavige had other sinister plans. He relentlessly pursued them, embedding a spy in their lives to report back on everything happening in Las Vegas, orchestrate cons against them, and ultimately tear their community apart. For the first time, Mark and Janis reveal the gripping details of their first year post-Scientology and introduce David Lubow, the spy who would become Scientology’s notorious Private Investigator and master of dirty tricks.

episodes.title: Scientology Ridiculous Copy Standards Leads to Massive Abuse
episodes.description:
L. Ron Hubbard recorded hundreds of lectures in the 1950s and 1960s, where he talked about Scientology, Dianetics and his research into Man.  These are considered sacred scripture by Scientology.  These lectures were also a source of income for Scientology and Hubbard.  Marc Headley joins Mark Fisher to tell the story of what happened in 1990 at the secret Gold Base when the Lecture copy production line did not meet David Miscavige's ridiculous standards for quality lecture copies, leading to the loss of hundreds of thousands of dollars and the full scale abuse of the staff members at the Gold Base by Miscavige that continued for months.

episodes.title: Scientology Teenagers Became Hubbard's Most Trusted Aides
episodes.description:
L. Ron Hubbard - the Scientology Founder and Commodore of the Sea Organization, initiated a unique crew of kids and teenagers as his Messengers aboard the flagship Royal Scotman, later known as Apollo. These young Messengers darted around the ship, delivering his vital messages and asking questions of the crew for the Commodore. Over time, these Messengers grew powerful within the Sea Organization, becoming key players in major events and eventually overseeing Scientology itself. Janis Gillham Grady stands out as one of the first four kids to join Hubbard, dedicating six hours a day, seven days a week, to his side for years. Dive into this captivating tale of their beginnings and explore her treasured collection of historical photographs from that era.

episodes.title: Inside Whispering WInds Ranch Where L. Ron Hubbard Died
episodes.description:
Peeling Classic - L. Ron Hubbard spent his final years in hiding from the Federal Government at a secret location in Creston, California, where he died in January 1986 due to a series of strokes. For years, he had been out of sight from both his family and devoted Scientology Sea Org Members. James Mortland, who managed Hubbard’s household unit at the Gold Base and oversaw the construction of key buildings, was dispatched to Creston after Hubbard's death, along with other staff, to upgrade and maintain the ranch. We had the chance to interview him, sharing captivating photos of the Creston Property and hearing interesting stories about Pat and Annie Broeker and about his time in the Sea Organization. 

This is a "PEELING CLASSIC" video that was first a live stream over 2 years ago.   We are re-releasing it for new viewers who may have missed it. episodes.title: Scientology & L. Ron Hubbard Start Making Movies
episodes.description:
In the late 1970s, at a remote desert location near LaQuinta, California, L. Ron Hubbard, the founder of Scientology, made a significant decision to start his very own movie studio. This venture aimed to create Scientology training films, which were intended to educate and inform members of the church about its teachings and practices. To bring this vision to life, he enlisted his inexperienced Sea Organization staff, who lacked the film production skills typically needed for such an ambitious project. The staff became the target of Hubbard's wrath and abuse when they didn't perform to his liking. In this video, Janis Gillham Grady and Stuart Moreau tell  the fascinating story of the beginnings of what later evolved into Golden Era Studios.

episodes.title: Inside Scientology: A Conversation with Pamela Nickel Williams
episodes.description:
Pamela Nickel Williams was born into Scientology.  Her parents got involved at the very beginnings of Scientology with L. Ron Hubbard in Wichita, Kansas in the early 1950s.   After she was born, her family followed Hubbard from Washington D.C. to Saint Hill Manor in England and then to the new Sea Organization Ship - Royal Scotman (later renamed Apollo).  Pam went to school with the Hubbard children on the ship.   She later moved with her family to the Scientology Advanced Organization in Los Angeles.   While in High School, she resisted joined the Sea Organization and instead left Scientology for good, never to return.   Her parents however remained connected to Scientology for years.  

Pam decided to reflect on her time as a child and teenager in Scientology and the choices that her parents made to stay loyal to Scientology and L. Ron Hubbard.    She has written a book - CLEARLY LIES ARE TRUE about her journey and it will be released soon.   We hope you enjoy this in depth interview with her.

episodes.title: Revealing Scientology's Neglect and Abuse of Children

Dan shares his story in detail on this video.   He and his wife at the time, were eventually kicked out and disgarded by Scientology 15 years later, along with their 15 year old son, to start their lives over.

episodes.title: Rare Interview: Larry Wollersheim's Scientology Experience
episodes.description:
NOT ONE THIN DIME FOR WOLLERSHEIM!  That was the slogan dreamed up by David Miscavige, the leader of Scientology, after Larry Wollersheim had won a $30 million judgement against Scientology and their mental abuses in the mid 1980s.  The judgement was reduced by a judge, but after years of appeals to higher courts and over 20 years of battle, Scientology finally paid him over $9 million dollars.  That is alot of thin dimes!

In a rate interview, Larry joins Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady to discuss how he got involved in Scientology, joined the Sea Organization, became one of the first completions on NED for OTs and then began experiencing psychological problems resulting in him leaving for good.  He then filed a lawsuit against Scientology and their mental abuses and was the target of Scientology attacks and Fair Game that went on for years.

Larry also discussed the healing that he has gone through over the years since leaving Scientology.   In afuture video, we will go into more details regarding that.

We hope you find this interview informative.

episodes.description:
Holly Carlson got involved with Scientology as a teenager in the late 1960s in Buffalo, New York and eventually joined the Sea Organization.   She was promoted through the ranks, rising to the level of Commanding Officer for the Western United States in her mid 20s.

Holly talks about having her first child in the Sea Organization and having to continue to work at her job.   She was sent to the Scientology Flagship Apollo for training and meets L. Ron Hubbard.   Holly was present on the Apollo when a riot occurred in Madiera, Portugal and the local rioters had to be repelled from the ship so the Apollo could leave the dock.

Holly then talks about being the Commanding Officer for the Western United States and how Scientology organizations were managed in the 1970s.

Holly later left Scientology and the Sea Organization in the early 1980s and is no longer a Scientologist.

Holly Carlson tells her story for the first time, about her experiences in Scientology and the Sea Organization (including the abuses that occurred) and why she left with her husband and children in 1982, never to return.

She got involved with Scientology in 1967 at age 17, along with her family in Buffalo, New York.  At 19 years old, she joined the Sea Organization in California and rose through the ranks, eventually becoming the Commanding Officer of all the Scientology Organizations in the Western part of the United States and then later, Commanding Officer of the Flag Land Base in Clearwater, Florida.

Holly finally left the Sea Organization in late 1982 after being assigned to the Rehabilitation Project Force.

Holly is no longer a Scientologist.

This is the first part of our interview with Holly Carlson.

episodes.title: Revealing the Truth: My Journey Out of Scientology

episodes.title: Interview - Bel Ferradj - From Stowaway on the Apollo to One of LRH's  Personal Counselors
episodes.description:
Bel Ferradj was living in Algeria in the late 1960s, when the Scientology Flagship Apollo came to port.  He was a local Ship Representative, not a Scientologist.  He decided he wanted to join L. Ron Hubbard and his Sea Organization, so he stowed away on the ship when it left port.

Bel quickly was trained up in Scientology Processing (Counseling) up to Class 8 and became L. Ron Hubbard's personal Auditor in the early 1970s on the Apollo.  He also was friends with Hubbard's eldest son, Quentin Hubbard and a brief romantic relationship with Hubbard's daughter, Diana Hubbard.

Bel has great stories to share from those times.   What it was like on the Apollo, how was Hubbard as someone receiving counseling, etc.

This is the first of a series of interviews with Bel Ferradj.   He is no longer a Scientologist and lives in Morocco.

episodes.title: Scientology Versus David Mayo and the Advanced Ability Center
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady are joined by Sandy Holeman to discuss who was David Mayo and what happened to the Advanced Ability Center that Mayo set up with other former Scientology senior executives and technical personnel to deliver counseling in competition to Scientology in the mid 1980s.

David Mayo was the Senior Case Supervisor International for Scientology, after years of training and interning with L. Ron Hubbard.   He was a Class 12 Senior Case Supervisor and was called upon to audit L. Ron Hubbard in the late 1970s when Hubbard was seriously ill and possibly could have died.

Hubbard turned against Mayo in the early 1980s, based on false reports by David Miscavige, resulting in Mayo being removed from his position, kicked out of Scientology and declared a Suppressive Person, along with many other senior Scientology executives.

Mayo then set up an outside group – the Advanced Ability Center (AAC) – with several other former executives and technical personnel (near Santa Barbara, California) to deliver counseling in competition with Scientology at greatly reduced pricing.

The Advanced Ability Center was then targeted heavily by Scientology and the Religious Technology Center for fair gaming and destruction.  The group was  infiltrated  by spies and the cult took legal actions against the AAC and Mayo himself.  The Advanced Ability Center eventually went out of business.

Sandy Holeman and her husband at the time, Roger Barnes, worked at the AAC during part of this time.  Sandy tells the story of what happened.
We hope you find this video informative.

episodes.title: How Scientology Technology and Policy Entraps People
episodes.description:
Dennis Erlich was a highly trained Scientology Technical Correction Officer at the Flag Land Base in Clearwater, Florida in the 1970s.  A legendary figure to some people, who was responsible for correcting the highest trained Scientology Counselors (Class 12s) in the world.

After leaving the cult in the early 80s, he eventually became one of the first people on the internet in the 90's, speaking out about Scientology Technology and Policy, quoting from these policies in on-line debates.  Scientology tried to stop all discussion of their confidential policies and materials on the internet.

So in 1995,  Scientology got a court to order his home raided by Scientology agents (along with Law Enforcement), ransaking his home and taking his computer hard drives, along with other items and materials.

Dennis and his attorneys fought for years against Scientology over this attack on free speech and eventually all of us can now speak out freely on the internet about Scientology abuses.

Dennis now helps others recover from time in Scientology and other cults.
In this video we discuss with him how the technology and policies of Scientology entrap people from the moment they come in for help.

episodes.title: Scientology Stories - False Reports & Paranoia Rule the Day
episodes.description:
Scientology was growing through the 1970s and early 1980s adding new organizations across the world that actually had people in them receiving processing and training, unlike the current empty "ideal orgs" that David Miscavige brags about.

However, based on false reports to L. Ron Hubbard by David Miscavige and others, which fed Hubbard's increasing paranoia while he was in hiding from the IRS and other lawsuits, in 1982 the top Scientology Management and Technical Executives were deemed as traitors and enemies of Hubbard and Scientology and were brought before a Scientology Justice Trial and summarily removed, kicked out of Scientology and declared Suppressive People.

This led to a reign of terror against the Scientology Mission Holder Network, which was a main source of new peopel into Scientology, under the direction of David Miscavige which resulted in their destruction.

A large exoduc occurred of Scientology Staff and Public at that time.

Sandy Holeman joins Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady in this Video to talk about what happened.   Her husband at the time (Roger Barnes) was one of the executives kicked out and Sandy was made to leave the Sea Organization and Scientology as well.

episodes.title: Scientology Story - The Man Behind the Billboards - Phil Jones
episodes.description:
Phil Jones and his wife Willy have been protesting for many years against the Scientology abuse of Disconnection.   Both their son and daughter are still in the Scientology cult and after Phil and Willy left years ago, their children stopped talking to them.  It is the policy of Disconnection.

Rather than doing nothing, Phil raised the funds to put up billboards in Los Angelas and Clearwater, Florida asking for their loved ones to call them.   Scientology fought them with harrassment and dirty tricks.   The billboards eventually came down.

Now Phil is back, with a new BIllboard that is posted outside the Scientology Big Blue Complex with a phone number that people trapped in Scientology and the Sea Organization can call for help.

Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady did an interview with Phil Jones in July 2023 as part of a longer video regarding disconnection.   This is the complete interview with Phil Jones where he tells his story.

We hope you find it informative.

episodes.title: Interview - John McLean - Former Sea Organization Member on the Apollo
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady are joined by John McLean for an interview.  John got involved in Scientology in the late 1960s as a teenager through his family up in Toronto, Canada.    He was recruited into the Sea Organization and sent to the Flagship Apollo at age 18 to work with L. Ron Hubbard.

John recounts stories about life on the Apollo, working with Hubbard and witnessing Hubbard's abuses.   

He also tell the story of the coup d'etat in Morocco against the King of Morocco while the Flagship Apollo and Hubbard were in the country trying to establish good relations with the Government.   Scientology decided to help the King locate those invoved with the coup by using Scientology Security Checking techniques (interogations) and John McLean was assigned the duty of getting the Scientology auditors together to do this.

The results did not turn out well and resulted in John deciding to leave the ship and the Sea Organization.  A fascinating story.

John is the son of Nan McLean, who became an outspoken critic of Scientology in Canada in the early 70's.   We will cover those stories in our next interview with John McLean.

We hope you enjoy this interesting video.

episodes.title: Scott & Karry Campbell's Horrific Story - Part One
episodes.description:
Scott and Karry Campbell join Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady to tell their horrifying story of abuse on the Scientology Sea Organization ship Freewinds.

Scott and Karry Campbell were 2 of the first people assigned to the Freewinds when the ship was first purchased and were trusted crew members who lived on the ship for several years.

Punishments increased on the ship in the early 1990s and Scientology Public were being made to donate large sums of money to the International Association of Scientologists when Scott began to speak out and report what was going on.

His Grandmother was on her death bed and his family was calling for him to come see her before she passed away.   Scott requested a short leave and it was denied.   

Not wanting to disappoint his large family, Scott left the Freewinds Ship and went into town to get a plane ticket to see his Grandmother and then come back to the ship.  Instead, Scientology Security captured him in town and physically put him in a vehicle, taking him back to the ship.

That began months of being locked up in a room on the Freewinds.  His food and drinks were drugged with Chloralhydrate and he was physically restricted to the room by his security guards for wanting to leave his captivity.   He was having a mental breakdown.

Meanwhile, his wife Karry was left to wonder what was going on, was told her husband was having a psychotic incident and was not allowed to see him.

After months of captivity on the ship, he was finally transported to the Scientology headquarters in Los Angelas with Karry where his captivity continued until they were finally let go and sent to Karry's Family home in California.  

However, that wasn't the end of the story.....

This is part 1 of this story of abuse.  Part 2 will be released in a few days.

episodes.title: Where Stars are Indoctrinated into Scientology -  Special Guest Robbie Levin
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady are joined by Special Guest Robbie Levin and tell much more about how Scientology Celebrity Centre began in 1969 by Janis' Mother Yvonne Gillham Jentzsch.  There are lots of never before seen photos included.

This is Part 2 of the story.

In this video, you will hear about how Robbie Levin left the Sea Organization, began a very successful business career and eventually left Scientology altogether.  This created disconnection between Robbie and his brother Geoff who remained in Scientology for many years before finally leaving himself.

As covered in Part 1, Robbie Levin was in a Rock Band called People in the mid 60s along with his brother Geoff Levin and several others.  They found out about Scientology and joined in 1968.   Robbie and his band were there with Yvonne at the very beginnings of Celebrity Centre  in Los Angeles and eventually they joined the Sea Organization while continuing to tour and perform as a rock band.  They eventually left the Sea Organization and Scientology.  

You will also hear Robbie's story about how he left Scientology, got a  repayment of his money still on his account and then went to the Clearwater Sun Newspaper to tell his story once he had left.

The documentary film Brothers Broken about the lives of Robbie and his brother Geoff Levin is touring the country right now.

After leaving Scientology in 1983, Kerry had a very successful career in business and eventually a happy retirement with his wife Jill Gleeson and their 3 daughters.

episodes.title: Scientology & Hubbard Locked Up Janis Gillham Grady!
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady are joined by their guest Tom Defour, a former Sea Organization and Scientology member.

Tom was with Janis when she was locked in a room for 11 days at the orders of Hubbard in 1978 at the secret location called "W" in LaQuinta, California because Janis reportedly had "Evil Purposes" towards Mary Sue Hubbard and was a "Rockslammer".

This of course was ridiculous since Janis had been with Hubbard since she was 12 years old, everyday for 6 hours a day for many years.  A dedicated Sea Org member at the time.

Tom Defour had been assigned the task of guarding Janis when she was locked up and instead of doing so, he "blew" Scientology (left) without telling anyone because of his disagreement with what was being done.

This is the first time Tom and Janis have seen each other is 45 years on this video.   We also cover how Tom got involved in Scientology and the Sea Organization as a young man and his work on the Sea Organization Ships located in the Southern California area - the Ares, Bolivar and Excalibur.

Never before seen photos of Janis, L. Ron Hubbard & Family and the secret location in LaQuinta, California.

episodes.title: Interview - Danielle Chamberlin - Abused as a 12 year old on the Flagship Apollo.
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady are joined by their guest Danielle Chamberlin from the UK.   

Danielle tells her story of being sent alone to the Sea Organization ship Apollo- as a 12 year old with no parent or guardian.  She suffered both physical and mental abuse at the hands of L. Ron Hubbard and others on the ship.    Danielle wasn't a Messenger  for Hubbard but instead worked in the ships galley and other areas doing manual labor without any adult looking after her.

Assigned to the Rehabilitation Project Force as a child and then later locked in the dark, dirty, dangerous chain locker for days as a punishment.  She finally left the ship and went back to England.

You will hear about L. Ron Hubbard's days in Rhodesia (Zimbabwe)  where he was eventually thrown out of the country by the government.

You will also hear about Danielle's life after leaving the Apollo and working in Scientology for several years before finally leaving.

Danielle is a loyal supporter and member of our channel.

episodes.title: From Sea Organization to Runway: Fashion Designers Share Their Journey | Live Stream
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady are joined for a live stream interview with world renown Fashion Designers and former Sea Organization members Claudio Lugli and his wife Renata Lugli.

Claudio and Renata helped to build Scientology in Italy in the later 70's and 80's.  They left the Sea Organization in 1982, but got back in good standing and remained public Scientologists until 2010 when they left the Church.

In the meantime, starting from nothing in 1982, they created a Fashion business in Italy that is known throughout the world.   They designed clothes for many celebrities and sports figures.

They became close personal friends with jazz greats Chick Corea, Stanley Clarke, Tommy Brechtlien as well as actress Kirstie Alley.

They also became the personal designers for David Miscavige and his wife Shelly Miscavige.

One of their sons, Tiziano Lugli, is a professional fashion photographer and recording artist.

Their other son, Flavio is still in the Sea Organization at the Flag Land Base and has been disconnected from his family since 2010.

episodes.title: How Scientology and Anonymous Collided: Inside the Internet Battle with Mitch Brisker
episodes.description:
Anonymous began an internet attack on Scientology in 2008 after Scientology tried to suppress free speech by forcing the internet to take down a video interview with Tom Cruise.   This led to worldwide protests by Anonymous, joined by former Scientologists and Sea Organization members, speaking out against the many abuses by the cult.  Thousands of people protested in front of Scientology Buildings worldwide.

What was Scientology's response?  

Special Guest Mitch Brisker was closely involved in David Miscavige's counter attack against Anonymous and the protesters as part of the inner circle of Scientology executives and professionals advising Miscavige.  Hear what was happening behind the scenes.

This stream will also include a general discussion about Scientology and their many mistakes in dealing with the internet over the years.

episodes.title: Former Scientology Film Director Mitch Brisker Speaks Out
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady interview former Scientology Film Director Mitch Brisker.  Brisker is a professional film director who was hired by Scientology in 1990 to Direct all of L. Ron Hubbard's Technical and Public Films at the Golden Era Productions base and continued as their Film Director for 28 years. He then worked for Scientology Media Productions - the Scientology TV Network for 2 years.

Hear Brisker's stories about filming at the Gold Base with the Sea Organization Film Crew.  During that time, he worked with many people and interacted with Scientology Leader David Miscavige.

Brisker also tells about his chance meeting running into Shelly Miscavige sometime in 2008, after she had disappeared.  He also discusses the last time he saw former Scientology President Heber Jentzsch.

Brisker covers the return of Marty Rathbun under Miscavige's and Scientology's control when Rathbun did his interviews attacking Leah Remini, Mike Rinder as well as others.

He also tells a humorous story about working with Mark Headley at the Gold Base and how competent Mark is.

This is Part 1 of our interviews with Mitch Brisker.  There are some camera issues with Mitch's camera, but the audio is clear and well worth watching this video.

episodes.title: Scientology - Creation of the Rehabilitation Project Force - Ken Urquhart Interview - Part 3
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady interview former Scientology Executive and Sea Organization member - Ken Urquhart about the creation of the Rehabilitation Project Force (RPF) Scientology's internal prison force.   

Urquhart wrote the original Sea Organization Policy creating the RPF under the direction of L. Ron Hubbard.  Find out why it was created, what the purpose was, how long it was supposed to take to graduate and much more. The RPF was a major form of abuse in Scientology.  

Hear how the time in the RPF was greatly increased through the sadistic and abusive orders of David Miscavige.  Graduation used to take a matter of weeks, but became a matter of years under Miscavige.

Urquhart also talks about his own experiences when he was later assigned to the RPF himself in the late 1970s.

Urquhart also discuses his regrets for having created the RPF.

episodes.title: Ken Urquhart - Former  L. Ron Hubbard Personal Communicator Interview
episodes.description:
Mark Fisher and Janis Gillham Grady are excited to welcome Ken Urquhart  to Our Scientology Stories - Peeling the Onion.   Ken got into Scientology in 1957 and later became L. Ron Hubbard's personal Butler at Saint Hill Manor in England.   He eventually was promoted to LRH Personal Communicator and worked daily with Hubbard for many years at Saint Hill, on the Flagship Apollo and at the Flag Land Base in Clearwater, Florida.

Ken tells stories of the early days at Saint Hill including working as a Butler for Hubbard and his family and the party for the first Clear at Saint Hill.  

See rarely seen photographs of life at Saint Hill in England.  Ken is now 85 years old, living in Scotland having left the Church of Scientology in the early 80s, having been declared a Suppressive Person by David Miscavige. 

This is the first of a series of interviews with Ken.  He is also widely known as the writer of the policy creating the Rehabilitation Project Force (RPF) on the Flagship Apollo.   We will be interviewing him about that in a future video.
